org.wonderly.util.jini
Class LookupEnv

java.lang.Object
  org.wonderly.util.jini.LookupEnv
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class LookupEnv
extends Object
implements Serializable

This class provides an environment container for use in Jini environments. It is intended to allow the programmer, deployer and user to have more freedom to select from a set of environments. This will be most useful to those using clients that run on a single device, and that device can be connected to the network through multiple means. In the office, a docked laptop may only need multicast lookup. On the floor connected via an 802.11 wireless network, a unicast lookup server may be needed, and when at home, connected via the VPN, a specific hostname may need to be used for all exported RMI objects. Thus, three instances of this class could be created/configured/made available to the user to select from so that they can find the desired services.

Author:
Gregg Wonderly.
See Also:

hostname - the hostname/ip address that should be used as java.rmi.server.hostname is
codebase - the codebase that should be used as java.rmi.server.codebase is.
